channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Assad Arrives in Russia After Fleeing Syria, Russian Media Says
item.description: President Bashar al-Assad landed in Russia, according to state media outlets there and two Iranian officials, after fleeing the country as rebels took...

item.title: South Korea Bars President From Traveling Abroad
item.description: President Yoon Suk Yeol cannot leave the country as an investigation unfolds into whether he led an insurrection last week when he briefly imposed mar...

item.title: Assad’s Syria Was Brutal. Will What Comes Next Be Better?
item.description: It is hard not to worry that Syrians’ sense of deep relief today could be followed by a new set of horrors tomorrow.

item.title: Biden says US troops will remain in Syria to fight ISIS as Assad regime collapses
item.description: U.S. forces on Sunday conducted air strikes on Islamic State camps and operations in Syria, Biden said.

item.title: Giorgia Meloni Is Ready to Bring Trumpism to Europe
item.description: Giorgia Meloni is ready to be the bridge between Donald Trump and Europe.

item.title: Beats by Dre designer Robert Brunner’s advice for creatives trying to make themselves heard: ‘Go take the comedy class’
item.description: "Learn how to stand up in front of people to communicate thoughts and ideas”, Ammunition founder Robert Brunner said at Fortune Brainstorm Design.

item.title: Notre-Dame Holds First Public Mass in Years: ‘Fire Has Not Conquered Stone’
item.description: Sunday was the first opportunity for worshipers to return to the cathedral, beloved by the faithful and secular alike, since the 2019 fire that devast...

item.title: Revolutions Swept the Middle East in 2011. Will Syria’s End Differently?
item.description: Bashar al-Assad’s downfall evokes memories of uprisings in Egypt, Libya, Tunisia and Yemen, each of which brought civil war or authoritarian rule. Syr...

item.title: Steve Mensch, President of Tyler Perry Studios, Dies at 62
item.description: Mr. Mensch, a longtime supporter of the film industry in Georgia, died in a plane crash on Friday in Florida, according to officials.

item.title: Generative AI can’t shake its reliability problem. Some say ‘neurosymbolic AI’ is the answer
item.description: Neurosymbolic AI could be a best-of-both-worlds marriage between deep learning and "good old-fashioned AI."

item.title: Who is Al-Jolani, the Syrian rebel who ended Assad’s rule?
item.description: Al-Jolani joined al-Qaeda in Iraq after the US invasion and was detained and jailed by the Americans there.

item.title: This was Bashar al-Assad’s mansion. Syrians are now helping themselves to its opulence after the ousted dictator fled to Russia
item.description: Crowds could be seen snatching clothes, plates and whatever belongings they could find including a Louis Vuitton cardboard shopping bag.

item.title: Monday Briefing
item.description: A historic transition of power in Syria.
